data.scheme_name: New Industrial Policy 2020-25-Additional Package of Incentives and Concessions for Export Industries-Existing
data.benefits: The Scheme provides various incentives such as Electricity Tax Exemption, Performance Subsidy, Bank Charges, ECGC Charges, Certification Charges and Fees for Acquiring Certification.
data.eligibility: Units engaged in Manufacturing and Manufacturing-related service industries are eligible under the scheme.
data.conditions: Units having a minimum of 50% of the turnover through exports
data.beneficiaries: Units engaged in Manufacturing and Manufacturing-related service industries are eligible under the scheme.
data.prerequisites:
Units having a minimum of 50% of the turnover through exports.
Eligible MSMEs shall commence commercial production within 3 years from the date of approval from the DLSWCC / SLSWCC. If any enterprise who has not taken approval from the DLSWCC / SLSWCC for their project for any reason shall commence commercial production within 3 years from the date of taking possession of land / building or taking building plan approval.
data.nodal_agency: State Level Co-ordination Committee (SLCC), Government of Karnataka
data.context: Government is pleased to announce the New Industrial Policy 2020-25, to build on the strengths of Karnataka industry and to enable it to fulfill its role as the engine of growth and to shoulder responsibility of adding more hi-tech value and employment. The new industrial revolution presents new opportunities for industry, particularly manufacturing and manufacturing-related service industries. These developments are enabling smart manufacturing, customization, collaborative production and other new production modes and business models.
data.objective: The aim is to attract INR 5 Lakh crore in investments, create 20 lakh jobs, achieve 3rd position in merchandise exports, maintain a 10% industrial growth rate, and foster an ecosystem for technology adoption and innovation.
data.description:
1. Reimbursements of Bank charges on production of Electronic Bank Realization Certificate (EBRC) for all exports from MSME sector in all Zones subject to maximum of INR 1 lakh per unit. 

2. Refund of certification charges incurred for obtaining statutory certifications like CE, China compulsory certificate (CCC), GMP, Phytosanitary certificates, IFS-BRC-FSSC 22000 Certification to the extent of 50% of expenses subject to maximum of INR 1.00 Lakh per unit in all Zones. 

3. Reimbursements of Export Credit Guarantee Corporation (ECGC) charges for MSMEs to an extent of 100% maximum of INR 1 lakh per unit per year in all Zones. 

4. Non - Monetary - Preferential Levy (Taxes/Penalties/Fees/Royalties)- 100% Electricity Tax exemption for new MSME Export Enterprises (Minimum 50% of the turnover should be in exports) for an initial period of 5 year in Zone-3. 

5. Refund of fees for individual entrepreneurs for acquiring certification on EXPORT-IMPORT Management course conducted by II, New Delhi or any other recognized institutions for a minimum duration of 4 months shall be reimbursed to the extent of 50% of fees subject to a ceiling of INR 25,000 per candidate per course. The incentive will be available only for one time and for one course in the policy period in all Zones subject to a maximum of INR 1.00 lakh per unit. 

6. MSME Enterprises who double their exports in subsequent years will be paid 1% of FOB value to the tune of maximum of INR 10.00 lakh per unit in all Zones.
data.how_to_apply: Applicant can register themselves on EBIZ- https://ebiz.karnataka.gov.in/kum/InvestorRegistrationForm.aspx
data.funding_facilitator: Commerce and Industries Department, Government of Karnataka
data.funding_mechanism: Amount will be disbursed to the beneficiary after approval of the application by the concerned authority.
data.additional_info:
1. List of Industrial Activities / Enterprises Not Eligible for Incentives and Concessions
    • Breweries & Distilleries of all types excluding winery & ethanol plant established as integral part of sugar industry.
    • Khandasari and Jaggery making enterprises.
    • Photo Studios & Color Processing and instant photo printing Enterprises.
    • Photo Copying / Xerox Machines / Fax Machines / Data Entry / Data Recovery enterprises.
    • Fertilizer mixing units.
    • All types of Saw Mills excluding manufacture of particle board / Low Density Fiber Board (LDF)/Medium Density Fiberboards(MDF)/High Density Fiber Boards(HDF).
    • Beedis / Cigarettes / Cigars / Gutka & Tobacco based products manufacturing enterprises.
    • Azoic / Reactive Dyes manufacturing enterprises.
    • Fire Cracker manufacturing enterprises.
    • Industries manufacturing Ozone depleting substances.
    • Laundries including Power Laundries.
    • Brick making Enterprises excluding Cement Hollow / Solid Blocks, Wire Cut, Fly Ash Bricks and Refractory Bricks.
    • Poultry including hatcheries.
    • Popcorn and Ice candy making Enterprises excluding Ice Cream Manufacturing.
    • Coffee roasting and grinding units having installed capacity of less than 2MT a day.
    • Clock and Watch / Mobile / Computer and Hardware equipment repair enterprises.
    • Cassette recording [Audio & Video] enterprises.
    • Cyanide Manufacturing enterprises.
    • Mining and Mining Equipment.
    • Lime kiln / burnt lime units.
    • X-ray clinics and clinical / pathological laboratories and scanning, MRI testing enterprises.
    • All industries of mobile nature like rigs, concrete / tar mixing plants / hot-mix plants including site oriented plants / industries.
    • Units engaged in manufacture of Chrysolite Asbestos (White Crystal).
    • All types of Saloon / Spas / Massage Centers, etc.
    • All types of hotels / restaurants / resorts / amusement parks, etc.
    • Vermicompost
    • Roof top solar power generation.
    • Bottling of LPG and other gases.
    • Aggregators/ supply chain business Enterprises related to / supporting bio-fuel manufacturing units *Considering the contribution to environment, eligible subsidy will be extended to new investments made on establishing of ETPs.
The Investment Promotion Subsidy is based on a percentage of turnover, depending on location and investments, for a specified period or fixed asset value. Eligible enterprises must register separately under GST for manufacturing eligible products, and only this turnover will be considered for the subsidy. Trading or non-eligible services at the same business location will disqualify the enterprise from the subsidy. The resale of products is not eligible for turnover incentives. If the enterprise is already manufacturing the same product in existing units, the turnover for five consecutive years must not be lower than the average of the previous three years. Only new investments qualify for the incentive.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Land/building-rent/lease agreement (If unit is rented /leased) 
2. Partnership deed / Articles of Association/byelaws 
3. Self-attested Project Report 
4. District Level Single Window Clearance Committee (DLSWCC) / State Level Single Window Clearance Committee (SLSWCC) approval order 
5. Udyam Registration Certificate /Industrial Entrepreneur Memorandum (IEM)/Industrial License (IL)  
6. IT Return of Individual Promoter (Proprietorship firm, Partnership Firm, Public Ltd. Company, Private Ltd. Company, Co-operative Society) 
7. PAN of Promoter/Company (Proprietorship firm, Partnership Firm, Public Ltd. Company, Private Ltd. Company, Co-operative Society) 
8. CA Certified net worth Statement of each Individual Promoter / Director (Proprietorship firm, Partnership Firm, Public Ltd. Company, Private Ltd. Company, Co-operative Society) 
9. Caste certificate (if applicable) 
10. Ex-service men certificate, if applicable 
11. Other Basic KYC Documents
